intro: Cynoglossum papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan deadnettle, is a flowering plant native to Papua and surrounding regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which is characterized by hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in whorls. Cynoglossum papuanum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
